# accessibilityScreenPoint(forLayoutPoint:)

**Instance Method**

Converts the provided point in the layout area’s coordinates to a point in the screen’s coordinate system.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilityScreenPoint(forLayoutPoint point: NSPoint) -> NSPoint
```

## Parameters

- **point**: A point in the layout area’s coordinate system.

## Return Value

A point in the screen’s coordinate system.

## Configuring layout

- **accessibilityHandles()**: Returns the drag handle elements for the layout item element.
- **setAccessibilityHandles(_:)**: Sets the drag handle accessibility elements for the layout item element.
- **accessibilityHorizontalUnits()**: Returns the units that the layout area uses for horizontal values.
- **setAccessibilityHorizontalUnits(_:)**: Sets the units that the layout area uses for horizontal values.
- **accessibilityHorizontalUnitDescription()**: Returns the description of the layout area’s horizontal units.
- **setAccessibilityHorizontalUnitDescription(_:)**: Sets the description of the layout area’s horizontal units.
- **accessibilityVerticalUnits()**: Returns the units that the layout area uses for vertical values.
- **setAccessibilityVerticalUnits(_:)**: Sets the units that the layout area uses for vertical values.
- **accessibilityVerticalUnitDescription()**: Returns the description of the layout area’s vertical units.
- **setAccessibilityVerticalUnitDescription(_:)**: Sets the description of the layout area’s vertical units.
- **accessibilityLayoutPoint(forScreenPoint:)**: Converts the provided point in screen coordinates to a point in the layout area’s coordinate system.
- **accessibilityLayoutSize(forScreenSize:)**: Converts the provided size in screen coordinates to a size in the layout area’s coordinate system.
- **accessibilityScreenSize(forLayoutSize:)**: Converts the provided size in the layout area’s coordinates to a size in the screen’s coordinate system.
